sen.j: 江戸時代の宮門跡の一つ、上野東叡山寛永寺貫主は、日光日光山輪王寺門跡を兼務し、比叡山延暦寺天台座主にも就任することもあった。
sen.e: The kanzu (a leader) of Ueno Toeizan Kanei-ji Temple, one of the miya-monzeki (temples headed by imperial princes) in the Edo period, doubled as head priest of Nikko-zan Rin-noji Temple and sometimes assumed Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect) of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei and was called Sanzan Kanryo no miya because they were all from Sanzan Kanryo no miya or Imperial princes.

sen.j: これは、敵対勢力が京都の天皇を擁して倒幕運動を起こした場合、徳川幕府が朝敵とされるのを防ぐため、独自に擁立できる皇統を関東に置いておくという徳川幕府の戦略だったとも考えられる。
sen.e: It is assumed that this was a strategy of Tokugawa shogunate to have the Imperial lineage in Kanto which was able to be enthroned independently to prevent Tokugawa shogunate from being considered as Emperor's enemy when enemy forces drove movement to overthrow the Shogunate enthroning Emperor in Kyoto.
It was believed that this was a strategy of the Tokugawa shogunate to obtain the Imperial lineage in Kanto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 語彙、冠詞
sen.e: It was believed that this was a strategy of the Tokugawa shogunate to obtain the Imperial lineage in Kanto.

sen.j: こうすれば、朝廷対朝敵の図式を、単なる朝廷の内部抗争と位置づけることができるからであり、実際に幕末には東武皇帝の即位として利用している。
sen.e: By doing that, the diagram between Imperial court and Emperor's enemy was positioned as just an internal struggle of Imperial court and it was actually used at Tobu Emperor's enthronement at the end of Edo period.

In doing so, the Shogunate was then able to position the Imperial court and the Emperor's enemy in such a way as to make it appear that this was just an internal struggle of the Imperial court; this strategy was actually used for the Tobu Emperor's enthronement at the end of Edo period.

sen.e: Only Ueno no miya (the leader of Kanei-ji Temple) and Nikkogu (head priest of Nikko-zan Rin-noji Temple) of the 7th generation were different people, but the 5th Nikkogu was reappointed as 7th, therefore the total number of people is not 14.

sen.j: 輪王寺宮の在任中であっても天台座主を兼ねない時期がありうるのだが、これは形式上のことで実質の権威は三山管領宮の名の通り一貫して宮門跡のものであった。
sen.e: Some of them didn't assume Tendai-zasu during the term of Rinojinomiya, but it was just for form and miya-monzeki had the actual authority consistently as the name of Sanzan Kanryo no miya.

Some head priests did not assume the Tendai-zasu position during the Rinojinomiya reign; however, as it was a ceremonial position miya-monzeki consistently had actual authority under the name of Sanzan Kanryo no miya.

sen.j: これはどういう意味かというと、江戸時代においては、天台宗を管領したのは東叡山寛永寺であって、比叡山延暦寺ではない。
sen.e: In other words, in the Edo period it was Toeizan Kanei-ji Temple that controlled theTendai sect and it was not Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei.

In other words, it was Toeizan Kanei-ji Temple who controlled theTendai sect in the Edo period but not Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei.

sen.j: 従って、ここでいう「天台座主」とは正確には比叡山延暦寺という一寺の座主のこと。
sen.e: Therefore what is called 'Tendai-zasu' here mean zasu of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei.
Therefore, 'Tendai-zasu' in this case, accurately means zasu (a head priest) of a temple called Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei.

sen.j: 明治以降、天台宗のトップの座は比叡山に戻り、江戸時代以前と以後（奈良時代から現代まで）を通算する都合上「天台座主」と称するが、江戸時代の実情とは異なる。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, the top position of theTendai sect returned to Mt. Hiei, therefore the actual condition was different from the Edo period though it is still called 'Tendai-zasu' to sum total before and after the Edo period (from the Nara period to modern age).

After the Meiji period, the top position of theTendai sect returned to Mt. Hiei; however, for the convenience of counting the positions before and after the Edo period (from the Nara period to modern age), it was called 'Tendai-zasu' although in actuality it was different from the Edo period.

After the Meiji period, the top position of theTendai sect returned to Mt. Hiei; however, for the convenience of counting the positions before and after the Edo period (from the Nara period to modern age), it was called 'Tendai-zasu' although in actuality it was different from the Edo period.

sen.j: 天台座主は在任期間が短く交代が早い。
sen.e: Tendai-zasu reigned short and was replaced soon.
The Tendai-zasu position had a short reign and a quick turn-over.
The Tendai-zasu position had a short reign and a quick turn-over.

sen.j: つまり輪王寺宮以外の僧も何人も天台座主となっているが、この実情により、輪王寺宮以外の天台座主は比叡山の一山の座主にすぎなかった。
sen.e: In other words, some Buddhist monks except those of Rinojinomiya became Tendai-zasu, however they were only a zasu of Mt. Hiei and the 2nd, 7th (Ueno no miya), 11the and the 13th of Rinojinomiya were not zasu of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei officially because of each reasons respectively, but they controlled the Tendai sect as a top of Kanei-ji Temple.
In other words, because of this, zasu except Rinojinomiya were only zasu on Mt. Hiei although several Buddhist monks became Tendai-zasu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In other words, because of the above reasons, although many Buddhist monks who were not Rinnoji no miya (title given to imperial princes who had entered the priesthood) became Tendai-zasu, they were just head priests of the temple on Mt. Hiei, not of the Tendai sect as a whole.

sen.j: 第2代・第7代（上野宮）・第11代・第13代の4人の輪王寺宮は、それぞれの理由により、公式には比叡山延暦寺座主になってはいないが、延暦寺のトップではなく寛永寺のトップとして天台宗を管領したことにかわりはない。
sen.e: Due to individual reasons, four Rinojinomiya, the 2nd, the 7th (Ueno no miya), the 11th, and the 13th, were not appointed as zasu of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei officially; however, it did not change the fact that they controlled the Tendai sect as the top of Kanei-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Due to individual reasons, four Rinnoji no miya, the 2nd, the 7th (Ueno no miya), the 11th, and the 13th, were not appointed as zasu of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei officially; however, it did not change the fact that they controlled the Tendai sect as the top of Kanei-ji Temple.

sen.j: 少々ややこしいが、慣例により江戸期の比叡山延暦寺座主のことをも天台座主とよんでいるのである。
sen.e: It is complicated a little, but zasu of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei in the Edo period is also called Tendai-zasu by convention.
